result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Timothy Grooms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Timothy Grooms is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph Timothy Grooms was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Counseling as probation request or require. 
Ct. 1 - Dismissed without prejudice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Timothy Grooms

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Timothy Grooms in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Jill Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF20 & 15CF119 @ 8:39 am.  State gives plea agreement ct 3 plea in 15CF20, ct's 2 & 4 DRI, 15CF119 DRI, 15CF20 Ct 1 dismissed w/o prejudice.  Victim is present in courtroom & victim rights have been complied with. 15CF20 Ct 3  withheld sentence 1 year probation, counseling & court costs.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge & penalties.  Ct 3 Battery, no contest plea. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Atty Dodge is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Court has reviewed complaint, no further facts.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Battery in ct 3 in 15CF20. Proceed to sentencing.  State gives sentencing statement. Atty Dodge gives sentencing statement.  Def. makes statement. State replys to victims rights. Court accepts plea agreement & orders  Ct's 2 & 4 DRI, Ct 1 Dismissed w/o prejudice.
Ct. 3 withheld sentence 1 year probation, counseling probation request or require & costs, 5 days credit if revoked, No DNA Sample or surcharge,  
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advise of postconviction rights. 15CF119 Dismissed.
Copy of Minutes given to S.D.
Defendant Joseph Timothy Grooms not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Conditions of bond removed.  No new bond needed.  Copy to S.D.
For Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order

No contact with A. J.  Any placement with children to be set by Dept of Social Services

Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  Complaint received, reviewed.  Statement by Atty Schuster for signature bond.  State request signature bond.  Conditions.  Bond set by court   Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Warrant canceled by court  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
